div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Jefferson Randolph Kean, May 23, 1901
div1.opener:
Pope has
the Dead Cinch
on the chain
of moses!
WAR DEPARTMENT,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM AND LIBRARY,
WASHINGTON.
May 23, 1901.
My Dear Doctor Kean:
div1.p:
Had I
postponed mailing my
letter of yesterday until
to-day, I would not now
have the pleasure of com-
muning with the High and
mighty Ruler of Cuban Chari-
ties &c. Impatient Dis-
penser of Correction
for the Pearl &c, cannot
you bridle your youth-
ful eagerness to know
the hidden things of the
future? at least for a
few short weeks? Wait
till - not eactly “till the clouds
roll by, Maria” - but until
the discoverer of the “fine
very fine small bacillus” an-
swers and states his side
of the question, and then,
perhaps, our ignorance
of sub-lunary things
will be less dense than
it is at present-“Go”
at least 10 pesas more
or rather mas, on ye
campign into Lazeario,
oh! may gordo hombre,
que tieue eu bolsa mir-
cho Ouiero Cubano (Dear
me! but somehow the Cast-
illian seems to come nat-
urally) just wait and
hold fast to what you
have until the mighty
George decides what is
best for this world and
a few others which he
proposes to make in the
near future. Then and not
till then will we know
what is to be done.
The entrails of Stegomyia
gives no clue to the
mighty agent etiological.
Neither do the Salivary gland,
of the Coy singer tell us
aught of interest - This
does not dampen our ardor
as long as we know that
our dear little moses, - I mean
George - gives utterance to
such sentiments as this:
“I have never doubted that
mosquitoes might be the means
of spreading yellow fever”. Pro-
ceedings Assocn Amer. Physicians,
Washington May 1-4,1901. Exact
words! Say, Rotund Keeper
of the Cuban Purse - Strings, which
compartment of Heaven con-
tains those who have been S.Gs?
I only want to avoid it! I am
almost ready now for that
long promised toot! Another
fraction of a grain of truth from
our moses, and I seek Bacchus'
embrace! Place me “at the feet” of
dear Mrs. Kean. Kiss the babies.
